choices.text:
### System: You are an AI assistant that follows instruction extremely well. Help as much as you can. ### User: How do you align a row of divs to the right using flex in css? Show me an example. ### Response: Sure! Here's how we would center-align three `div` elements horizontally and vertically with CSS Flexbox, assuming they have equal width/height dimensions (e.g., each element is a square): ```html
Element 1
Element 2
Element 3
``` CSS: ```css .container { display: flex; /* enable Flexbox */ justify-content: center; /* horizontally align elements to the middle of container */ align-items: center; /* vertically align elements in the middle of their containers */ } /* set width/height dimensions for each element, assuming they are equal size */ .container > div { height: 100px; } ``` This will result in a container with three centered `div` elements that have the same horizontal and vertical center points as their parent container (`.container`).
